DOCNAME: CASE OF NICOLAE CONSTANTINESCU v. ROMANIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lived in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , together with CARDINAL relatives , lodged a civil action claiming restitutio in integrum of a mill , the property of their parents , which had been taken by the ORG in DATE .
CARDINAL . Of the CARDINAL hearings held DATE and CARDINAL DATE , CARDINAL were adjourned at the applicant ’s request .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ ORG ” ) rejected the action , considering that the mill had been nationalised in accordance with the law and that therefore the applicant and his relatives had no right of property .
CARDINAL . The applicant and his relatives appealed . Of the CARDINAL hearings held DATE and DATE one was adjourned at the applicant ’s request .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) , taking into account the expert ’s report produced during the appeal , dismissed the appeal as being groundless .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the Court of Appeal ” ) by a final decision upheld the findings of the lower courts , considering that the nationalisation had been lawful .

CARDINAL . The applicant and his relatives made use of extraordinary remedies and on CARDINAL DATE ORG allowed the application to set aside the final decision of DATE , quashed the previous judgments and sent the case back for fresh examination . The court noted that under Government Ordinance no . CARDINAL ORG should have been summoned to appear in the proceedings as the ORG ’s representative .
CARDINAL . During the retrial , of the CARDINAL hearings held DATE and DATE CARDINAL were adjourned at the applicant ’s request .

On DATE ORG held that it had no jurisdiction ratione materiae , considering the case to be within the competence of ORG . On DATE ORG also refused to exercise jurisdiction . Following the dispute as to jurisdiction , ORG decided on DATE that it was ORG which had jurisdiction ratione materiae .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , having regard to the CARDINAL experts’ reports and to the witnesses produced during the retrial , upheld in part the action lodged by the applicant and his relatives , considering that the legal requirements for nationalisation had not been fulfilled and therefore the ORG had no valid title . The court granted restitutio in integrum in respect of the mill and of the appurtenant land .
CARDINAL . The defendant party appealed . Of the QUANTITY hearings held DATE and DATE none was adjourned as a result of requests by the applicant . A new expert ’s report was produced .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the appeal by the defendant and rejected on the merits the action lodged by the applicant and his relatives , considering that the nationalisation had been lawful . That decision was upheld on DATE by a final decision of ORG .
